description._content: Description: Fushun Power Plant - Fushun, Manchuria. Photographed by U.S. Signal Corps, 17 June 1946. Large Power Plant (View Number 3), showing one end of building from which four power-generating units, including condensers and all important accessories, were removed during period of Soviet occupancy. Location: Fushun, China Date: 17 June 1946 ------------------------------------------------------ Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/441. This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives. Feel free to share it within the spirit of the Commons. Please use the comments section below the pictures to share any information you have about the people, places or events shown. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
